title: Stochastic optimal control of L\'evy tax processes with bailouts
authors: Dalal Al Ghanim and Ronnie Loeffen and Alexander R. Watson
abstract:
We consider controlling the paths of a spectrally negative L\'evy process by
two means: the subtraction of `taxes' when the process is at an all-time
maximum, and the addition of `bailouts' which keep the value of the process
above zero. We solve the corresponding stochastic optimal control problem of
maximising the expected present value of the difference between taxes received
and cost of bailouts given. Our class of taxation controls is larger than has
been considered up till now in the literature and makes the problem truly
two-dimensional rather than one-dimensional. Along the way, we define and
characterise a large class of controlled L\'evy processes to which the optimal
solution belongs, which extends a known result for perturbed Brownian motions
to the case of a general L\'evy process with no positive jumps.
